science: Octopuses have three hearts.
Bananas contain naturally occurring radioactive potassium.
Water can boil and freeze at the same time under specific pressure conditions.
The number of possible chess games is greater than the number of atoms in the observable universe.
Humans share a significant amount of genetic material with many living organisms, including plants.
A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus.
Light from the Sun takes about 8 minutes to reach Earth.
The human brain uses roughly 20 percent of the body's energy.
Honey can remain edible for thousands of years if sealed properly.
Sharks existed before trees.
Sound travels faster in water than in air.
Glass is an amorphous solid, not a liquid.
Wombat feces are cube-shaped.
Taste receptors exist outside the tongue, including in the lungs and gut.
The human body emits a very faint visible light due to biochemical reactions.
Hot water can freeze faster than cold water under certain conditions.
Butterflies retain memories formed during their caterpillar stage.
Atoms consist mostly of empty space.
Humans have more bacterial cells than human cells in their bodies.
DNA can store vast amounts of information in a very small space.
Neutrinos pass through your body in large numbers every second.
Your bones are constantly being broken down and rebuilt.
The speed of light is constant in a vacuum.
Humans share about 99.9 percent of their DNA with each other.
Some metals expand when they freeze.
Plants can respond to light, gravity, and touch.
The heart can continue beating outside the body if supplied with oxygen.
The brain generates enough electricity to power a small light bulb.
Humans can adapt physiologically to high altitudes.
Cells are the basic building blocks of life.
Gravity is the weakest of the four fundamental forces.
history: Cleopatra lived closer in time to the Moon landing than to the construction of the Great Pyramid.
Oxford University predates the Aztec Empire.
Napoleon Bonaparte was reportedly attacked by rabbits during a hunt.
Ancient Romans used urine as a cleaning agent.
The shortest recorded war lasted between Britain and Zanzibar in 1896.
Julius Caesar was captured by pirates early in his life.
The Eiffel Tower was originally intended to be temporary.
Samurai existed during the same period as cowboys.
Ancient Egyptians practiced basic dentistry.
The Great Wall of China is not visible from the Moon with the naked eye.
Ketchup originated as a fermented fish sauce.
Medieval manuscripts sometimes depict knights fighting snails.
George Washington grew hemp at Mount Vernon.
The first alarm clock could only ring at a single preset time.
Ancient Greeks developed early vending machines.
The Colosseum hosted naval reenactments called naumachiae.
Pineapples were once rare luxury items in Europe.
Roman emperors kept exotic animals as pets.
The printing press transformed information distribution in Europe.
Vikings traveled as far as North America.
Paper money was first used in China.
Ancient Rome had complex road networks.
The Library of Alexandria was a major center of learning.
Medieval castles often doubled as administrative centers.
Eyeglasses were invented in the 13th century.
Ancient civilizations tracked astronomical events.
The calendar has been reformed multiple times.
The concept of zero originated in ancient India.
Writing developed independently in multiple regions.
Public baths were common in ancient Rome.
The wheel predates written language.
weird: Some turtles can breathe through specialized cloacal structures.
Scotland has hundreds of words related to snow.
Humans can often smell rain due to airborne compounds.
Clouds can weigh more than a million tons.
Sloths can hold their breath for extended periods.
Antarctica has naturally occurring red-colored waterfalls.
Cows form social bonds with preferred companions.
There are more plastic flamingos than live flamingos in some regions.
Mantis shrimp can strike with extremely high acceleration.
Certain metals react violently with water.
Some jellyfish species can revert to an earlier life stage.
Plants can detect and respond to stress signals.
Trees exchange nutrients through underground fungal networks.
Some frogs can survive being frozen.
Microscopic organisms live on human skin.
The Moon experiences seismic activity.
Certain animals can regenerate lost body parts.
Octopuses can solve complex puzzles.
Bees can recognize human faces.
Some fish can change sex during their lifetime.
Birds can sleep with one half of their brain.
Humans can experience synesthesia.
Some bacteria can survive extreme radiation.
Spiders can fly using electrical fields.
Ants can form living bridges.
Some plants are carnivorous.
Certain animals can detect Earth's magnetic field.
Fungi are genetically closer to animals than plants.
Some worms can regrow entire bodies.
Bacteria can communicate chemically.
movies: The sound of lightsabers was created using electronic interference.
The T-Rex roar in Jurassic Park is a blend of animal sounds.
The Matrix digital rain was inspired by sushi recipes.
The Lord of the Rings trilogy used thousands of real props.
Psycho was among the first films to show a flushing toilet.
Toy Story was the first fully computer-animated feature film.
The Godfather cat was a stray adopted during filming.
Asbestos was used as fake snow in early Hollywood films.
Back to the Future originally planned a refrigerator time machine.
Harrison Ford used a gun in Raiders of the Lost Ark due to illness.
The Wilhelm scream appears in many films.
The Dark Knight hospital explosion was filmed practically.
Mechanical sharks malfunctioned during Jaws production.
Mad Max featured real stunt crashes.
Inception used rotating sets for hallway scenes.
Rocky was written in a few days.
The Blair Witch Project used improvisation.
Home Alone used a real tarantula.
Alien’s chestburster scene surprised the cast.
Titanic used cold water tanks.
Star Wars reused props extensively.
Casablanca was filmed largely out of sequence.
The Wizard of Oz used early color film.
Many silent films are now lost.
Alfred Hitchcock made cameo appearances in his films.
The original King Kong used stop-motion animation.
Some films were shot without completed scripts.
Practical effects were common before CGI.
The Oscars began in 1929.
Movie trailers were originally shown after films.
Film reels were once highly flammable.
games: Pac-Man was inspired by a slice of pizza.
Mario was originally depicted as a carpenter.
The PlayStation began as a Nintendo collaboration.
Tetris was created in the Soviet Union.
Minecraft was written in Java.
The Xbox name comes from DirectX.
The first video game Easter egg appeared in Adventure.
Pokémon was inspired by insect collecting.
DOOM has been ported to many devices.
World of Warcraft has hosted in-game memorials.
Sonic was created to compete with Mario.
The Konami Code originated as a testing tool.
Grand Theft Auto maps are inspired by real cities.
Nintendo began as a playing card company.
The Sims uses a fictional language.
Zelda was inspired by childhood exploration.
Halo was originally planned as a strategy game.
Pac-Man ghosts follow distinct AI patterns.
Skyrim has been released on many platforms.
Speedrunning formed its own communities.
Arcades popularized competitive gaming.
The first consoles used cartridges.
Games once shipped incomplete due to memory limits.
Multiplayer gaming predates the internet.
Early games had no save systems.
Controllers evolved from simple joysticks.
LAN parties popularized multiplayer games.
Some games include hidden developer rooms.
Speedrunning exploits game mechanics.
Game music influenced modern composers.
Virtual economies exist in online games.
boring: Clouds are visible due to water droplets.
Most people blink around 15 times per minute.
The adult human body has 206 bones.
The Sun rises in the east.
music: The Beatles could not read traditional sheet music.
Mozart composed music at a young age.
Some musical compositions last several hours.
Drums are among the oldest instruments.
Heavy metal emerged in the late 1960s.
Beethoven composed while losing his hearing.
Guitars date back thousands of years.
Hip hop originated in the Bronx.
The voice is a musical instrument.
Silence is an element of music.
geography: Russia is the largest country by area.
Africa is larger than the USA, China, and Europe combined.
Australia is wider than the Moon.
Mount Everest grows slightly each year.
The Nile is one of the world's longest rivers.
Canada has a vast number of lakes.
Japan consists of thousands of islands.
Chile stretches over a long north-south distance.
Greenland is mostly covered by ice.
The Dead Sea lies below sea level.
France shares borders with multiple countries.
Vatican City is the smallest country.
Nepal contains many of the tallest mountains.
Brazil contains much of the Amazon rainforest.
Islands can be volcanic or continental.
